ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great opportunity to work with real datasets and investigators. Having a product at the end of the course that can be submitted for publication is very fulfilling.
We had our own projects in this semester. Learned a lot from the collaboration and discussion.
Great opportunity to get exposed to the consulting setting. Not only learned how to do analysis, but also how to write, present, and communicate.

Stat consulting lab is a helpful course for biostat students as most of them will end up in offering stat consulting as part of their job. Spring section of this course is more practice oriented and instructors were giving us suggestions specifically to the problem we are working on, as well as the write-ups and presentation we are giving.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Lisa Calvocoressi  Professor Calvocoressi is very responsible. She gave us many helpful comments and suggestions on our write-ups. Each time I got my write-up back, it was carefully revised. I really appreciate her help over the past semester.
Instructor: Lisa Calvocoressi  Lisa generously offered one-to-one revision session for our midterm and final reports, which has been extremely helpful to improve my writing.

Instructor: Lisa Calvocoressi  Lisa is patient and helpful. She always willing to listen to students' questions and give them constructive advice. She also works with us closely with our write-ups and presentation.
Instructor: Michael John Kane  Please don't have lunch in class.
Instructor: Michael John Kane  He is a great instructor, too! Gave us many suggestions on statistical methods.
Instructor: Michael John Kane  Like Michael's questions and comments on each of my presentations. Always inspired me to think of the question from another perspective.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Great instructor. Professor Peduzzi was always open to suggestions in class. Based on his rich experience, his advices were always helpful.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Peter's comments and suggestions are constructive and helpful.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I will recommend it to other students.
